objectives: Students will discuss food and dining out using Informal/Conversational register language
Students will engage with Comedy themed scenarios related to food and dining out
Students will demonstrate appropriate use of informal level vocabulary and expressions
Students will create dialogues combining food and dining out content with Comedy narrative elements

warm_up.description: Students explore food and dining out through a Comedy lens using Informal/Conversational language
warm_up.scenario: Imagine a humorous misunderstanding or funny situation involving food and dining out

main_activities.description: Students learn and practice informal register vocabulary related to food and dining out in a comedy context
Students engage in comedy themed role-play about food and dining out using informal register
Students create original comedy themed content about food and dining out in informal register

discussion_questions: How would you describe food and dining out in a Comedy scenario?
What hilarious or amusing might be involved in food and dining out?
Can you create a Comedy story about food and dining out?
How does food and dining out change when viewed through a Comedy perspective?
What informal register expressions would you use to discuss this comedy scenario?

role_play_scenarios.scenario: Comedy situation involving food and dining out
roles: Character A: Using informal register in comedy context
Character B: Responding in informal register within comedy theme

topic_genre_blend: food and dining out with hilarious
food and dining out with amusing
food and dining out with ridiculous

teacher_transformation_guide.register_guidance: Use Informal/Conversational throughout: Friendly, relaxed everyday speech
teacher_transformation_guide.genre_guidance: Frame all content with Comedy theme: Humor, wit, funny situations

assessment.register_focus: Students demonstrate mastery of Informal/Conversational register
assessment.genre_focus: Students engage with Comedy themed content
criteria: Appropriate use of informal register language
Comprehension of topic within new context

methodology: Augmented CLT with Register & Genre Transformation
